title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 529/2002 of 22 March 2002 determining the extent to which applications lodged in March 2002 for import licences under the regime provided for by tariff quotas for certain products in the pigmeat sector for the period 1 April to 30 June 2002 can be accepted
header:
Commission Regulation (EC) No 529/2002
of 22 March 2002
determining the extent to which applications lodged in March 2002 for import licences under the regime provided for by tariff quotas for certain products in the pigmeat sector for the period 1 April to 30 June 2002 can be accepted
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to Commission Regulation (EC) No 1486/95 of 28 June 1995 opening and providing for the administration of tariff quotas for certain products in the pigmeat sector(1), as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1006/2001(2), and in particular Article 5(5) thereof,
Whereas:
The applications for import licences lodged for the second quarter of 2002 are for quantities less than the quantities available and can therefore be met in full,
main_body: Applications for import licences for the period 1 April to 30 June 2002 submitted pursuant to Regulation (EC) No 1486/95 shall be met as referred to in the Annex.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 April 2002.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 22 March 2002.
For the Commission
Franz Fischler
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ L 145, 29.6.1995, p. 58.
(2) OJ L 140, 24.5.2001, p. 13.
ANNEX
>TABLE>
